intro: Convolvulus minor, commonly known as lesser bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers with five petals, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are heart-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. The plant has a fibrous root system and is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in gardens.
